# uptimekuma_monitor_grpc_keyword (Resource)

gRPC Keyword monitor resource checks for the presence (or absence) of a specific keyword in the gRPC response. The monitor makes a gRPC request and searches for the specified keyword in the response. Use `invert_keyword` to reverse the logic: when false (default), finding the keyword means UP; when true, finding the keyword means DOWN.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "uptimekuma_monitor_grpc_keyword" "example" {
  name              = "gRPC Service Monitoring"
  hostname          = "grpc.example.com"
  port              = 50051
  grpc_service_name = "myapp.v1.Health"
  keyword           = "SERVING"
  interval          = 60
  timeout           = 30
  max_retries       = 2
  upside_down       = false
  active            = true
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `grpc_method` (String) gRPC method name to call
- `grpc_service_name` (String) gRPC service name from the protobuf definition
- `grpc_url` (String) gRPC server URL (e.g., localhost:50051 or example.com:443)
- `keyword` (String) Keyword to search for in the response body (case-sensitive). The monitor will search for this exact text in the gRPC response.
- `name` (String) Friendly name

### Optional

- `active` (Boolean) Monitor is active
- `description` (String) Description
- `grpc_body` (String) Request body in JSON format
- `grpc_enable_tls` (Boolean) Enable TLS for gRPC connection
- `grpc_protobuf` (String) Protocol Buffer definition (proto3 syntax)
- `interval` (Number) Heartbeat interval in seconds
- `invert_keyword` (Boolean) Invert keyword match logic. When false (default), finding the keyword means UP and not finding it means DOWN. When true, finding the keyword means DOWN and not finding it means UP.
- `max_retries` (Number) Maximum number of retries
- `notification_ids` (List of Number) List of notification IDs
- `parent` (Number) Parent monitor ID for hierarchical organization
- `resend_interval` (Number) Resend interval in seconds
- `retry_interval` (Number) Retry interval in seconds
- `upside_down` (Boolean) Invert monitor status (treat DOWN as UP and vice versa)

### Read-Only

- `id` (Number) Monitor identifier
